title: The Cove Walking the Plank
description: In 2024, at Christopher Newport University, a renowned History Professor named Otto Leroy Maynard stumbles upon a mystery that ties his own lineage to one of the most notorious figures in historyâ€”Edward Teach, better known as Blackbeard. Set in the historically rich state of Virginia, famously known for its slogan "Virginia is for Lovers," this story seamlessly intertwines the past with the present.Otto's journey begins with his fascination with Blackbeard, a pirate whose reign of terror spanned from 1716 to 1718. With a towering presence and a fearsome reputation, Blackbeard captured between 20 to 40 ships during his short but impactful career. As Otto delves deeper into Blackbeard's life, he discovers that this tale doesn't merely belong to the past; it has deep roots in the present.And here begins the tale of "The Cove." You might be wondering, what exactly is a cove? For starters, these mysterious places have hidden entrances, often tucked away behind towering cliffs. They served as secret fortresses were pirates could anchor their ships, stash their plunder, and vanish from the authorities' reach. These coves are small, sheltered bays or coastal inlets, scattered along rugged coastlines, offering natural harbors that provided both safety and seclusion to those who understood their hidden paths. On the Voyage to "THE COVE WALKING THE PLANK"
author: Bryant Johnson
